Authors:
Eugénio Diogo, Catarina I. Gonçalves, Ana C. Silva, Carlos
Valente, Helena Bragança, Alan J.L. Phillips
Title:
Five new species of Neopestalotiopsis associated with
diseased Eucalytpus spp. in Portugal
Keywords:
Coelomycetes, Eucalyptus globulus, new species, plant
pathogens, phylogeny, Sporocadaceae, taxonomy.
Abstract:
Eucalyptus globulus, an exotic species in Portugal, is the
most dominant and intensively managed forest species in the country. A
diseases causing stem girdling and cutting dieback in eucalyptus
associated with Pestalotiopsis like fungi has been detected in nurseries
and young plantations in the last years. Twenty-two isolates were
recovered from diseased seedlings in nurseries and from young plants in
the field. Phylogenetic analysis based on internal transcribed spacers,
partial translation elongation factor 1-α gene and partial β-tubulin
gene sequence data grouped the isolates in five separate clades.
Combining morphological, cultural, and molecular data, five new species
of Neopestalotiopsis are described, Neopestalotiopsis eucalyptorum,
Neopestalotiopsis hispanica, Neopestalotiopsis iberica,
Neopestalotiopsis longiappendiculata and Neopestalotiopsis
lusitanica.
